name: Robert D. SCHAFFER, Jr., Appellant, v. Charles KOENIG, Thomas Clauss, Terry Hemerly, Donald J. Snyder, James O. Kirkland, Dennis O'Leary, Karl E. Emerson, Peter J. Smith, Afscme Council 13, Allan J. Bevevino, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Department of Transportation, Howard Yerusalem, Appellees

parties: Robert D. SCHAFFER, Jr., Appellant, v. Charles KOENIG, Thomas Clauss, Terry Hemerly, Donald J. Snyder, James O. Kirkland, Dennis O’Leary, Karl E. Emerson, Peter J. Smith, Afscme Council 13, Allan J. Bevevino, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Department of Transportation, Howard Yerusalem, Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 6th day of November, 1996, the direct appeal is quashed; the matter is treated as a petition for allowance of appeal and is denied.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
684 A.2d 551
Robert D. SCHAFFER, Jr., Appellant, v. Charles KOENIG, Thomas Clauss, Terry Hemerly, Donald J. Snyder, James O. Kirkland, Dennis O’Leary, Karl E. Emerson, Peter J. Smith, Afscme Council 13, Allan J. Bevevino, Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Department of Transportation, Howard Yerusalem, Appellees.
No. 143 Middle District Appeal Docket 1996.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Nov. 6, 1996.
